page.title: 19ECOLOGY AND ENVIRONMENT
page.content: The weather varies considerably throughout the year but not to any great extreme. Any snowfall tends to drift blocking roads because the land is flat and open. In warm dry summer seasons sand storms occur due to the flatness of land and the sandy soil. This has been aggrevated by farmers cutting down and removing trees and hedgerows to make larger easier to work fields. The country roads are in a resonable condition but some are very narrow particularly in view of the large farm machinery in use today. Many verges are damaged by cars trying to pass each other. The buildings in the villages are generally pleasant but improvements could be made to pavements, there being only three in Marston but more are planned.
